title: Cara Care: FODMAP, IBD, IBS Tracker, Poop Tracker
description:
Cara Care takes the mystery out of your digestion. It‚Äôs the easiest way to holistically manage and track GI issues like IBS, IBD, GERD, Celiac, dyspepsia, or food intolerances.

Track and log your poop, stress, food, pain, and other symptoms (e.g. from IBS) with just a few taps. 

The app shows you what your food and symptoms are on your best and worst IBS days.

Start making connections between your diet, your gut, and your overall well-being.

Cara Care‚Äôs premium 12-week IBS program is your personalized guide to following the low FODMAP diet. You‚Äôll get unlimited text chat with a personal dietitian helps you every step of the way in navigating your IBS and beginning low FODMAP. Based on 5,000+ hours of nutritional counseling with people who have IBS. 

-------

UNLIMITED ACCESS TO OUR BEST IN CLASS IBS TRACKER AND POOP TRACKER

üçú Food Tracker: Save time by adding your favorites and photos if you follow low FODMAP, gluten free, or other diets
üßª Poop Tracker: Log different types of bowel movements
üìã Symptom Tracker: Track bloating, constipation, diarrhea, pain, and other IBS symptoms
ü©∫ Medical Log: Record important information about your period, skin, workouts, sleep, pain, and medication

PERSONALIZED ANALYSIS

‚úÖ Food on your best and worst days is shown in your dashboard 
‚úÖ Share your app data easily with your primary care provider or gastroenterologist
‚úÖ Access a library of actionable, science-based tips for living with IBS
‚úÖ Low FODMAP recipes

MAKE LIFE WITH IBS EASIER: JOIN A 12-WEEK IBS LOW FODMAP PROGRAM

üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Free unlimited text chat with your personal dietitian
üìä Get personalized analysis on your symptoms and diet from your dietitian
ü•£ Follow a self-paced, 12-week action plan for the low FODMAP IBS diet  
üî¨ Get science-backed tips on managing IBS, with actionable takeaways at every step
üìù Track your progress with medically-validated questionnaires 

CARA CARE USER PHOEBE SAYS:

"With Cara Care, for the first time I had the feeling that someone wanted to help me. Thanks to the program, I felt much better! Of course there are problems here and there, but I have made a lot of progress and can enjoy eating again." ‚Äì Phoebe

NOT JUST FOR IBS. 

Cara Care is designed for people with chronic gut conditions such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and IBD (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis and microscopic colitis). But Cara Care‚Äôs symptom tracker can also help you with:

‚Ä¢ Bowel problems such as acid reflux, dyspepsia, nausea, chronic abdominal pain, bloating, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with symptoms such as chronic bloating, abdominal pain, constipation and diarrhea
‚Ä¢ Short bowel syndrome, small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), gastritis, celiac disease
‚Ä¢ Diets such as gluten-free, fructose-free, histamine-free and lactose-free, clean eating, healthy eating, keto
‚Ä¢ Food intolerances and sensitivities such as dairy, lactose, cow's milk allergy, fructose, histamine, gluten/wheat
‚Ä¢ Leaky gut syndrome & Candida albicans
‚Ä¢ Period/menstrual cycle-related digestive problems

We would ‚ù§Ô∏è to hear from you.

Send your questions, suggestions, and feedback to hello@cara.care
Find us on: https://cara.care

comments: Great While It Lasted. I really thought I had found the perfect app to track my symptoms. I spent a huge amount of time entering info. Then, I made the mistake of logging out. Now it won't let me log back in. It says it's sending me a confirmation email to restore my data. But I'm not getting it. I've tried a dozen times & checked my spam/junk folder a hundred times. I'm not receiving the email. I'm so very disappointed. I haven't found another app that covers so much detail. :-(

Adding food and meds can be tedious as a lot of options aren't available. This makes sense as the developer is based in Germany and I live in the US. I also don't add each ingredient, because so many foods have some degree of salt or oil, and those show up in the "best/worst ingredients," even though I know those aren't my triggers. I think the most irritating part is that when I add "no poop" so I can log symptoms, it shows in the report that I pooped. Still a mostly useful app.

I like the idea of this, especially the food tracker to see what foods may be causing me trouble. The only really frustrating part is also the food tracker. They only seem to have half the things I try and put in and it really isn't that user friendly with that function either. The rest of it works pretty well so, despite the food tracker being what I really wanted, I mostly just record symptoms which, in itself, is still helpful.

Great app and is very detailed with a nice user interface. My only critism is when adding pictures to food - it automatically offers to crop or zoom in a landscape rectangle and you can never get the full thing you want in the picture as you can only get part of it. It would be better if it was free crop or zoom within a certain squared area, not a landscape rectangle. An option to export to excel would also be great.
The UI experience is bad and not intuitive. I found it frustrating to use.

title: mySymptoms Food Diary & Symptom Tracker (Lite)
description:
Record, track, and analyze your food, mood, and symptoms to gain insights into your digestive health. 

mySymptoms makes logging a food and symptom diary easy - remembering your favorite foods and providing customizable symptoms. The diary analysis reveals any patterns that emerge between your diet and symptoms. Print a PDF (Android 4.4 or above) / web report of your diary/journal.


DIARY / JOURNAL

‚Ä¢ Record food, drink, medication, stress, exercise, environmental factors, and other activities and notes 
‚Ä¢ Record any symptoms you experience (including intensity, duration, and notes) 
‚Ä¢ Record your energy, sleep quality, and bowel movements (using Bristol scale)
‚Ä¢ View and modify your diary entries 
‚Ä¢ Create and modify your own symptoms 
‚Ä¢ Export your food diary as a PDF (Android 4.4 or above), CSV, or Web report for printing or sharing


INSIGHTS

‚Ä¢ Discover any patterns between your diet and symptoms
‚Ä¢ View suspect foods, trends, and correlations between food and symptoms
‚Ä¢ Configurable analysis


ORGANIZER 

‚Ä¢ Add or modify your own drinks, foods, medications, exercises, and other activities 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify meals with your own ingredients 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify detailed ingredients to any item ‚Äì food, drink or medication 


HOW TO USE

‚Ä¢ Simply begin by tracking your meals along with any symptoms you experience
‚Ä¢ Over time, the more you track, the more the analysis algorithms have to work with to provide any insights


mySymptoms is used by sufferers of:

‚Ä¢ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚Ä¢ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerance and sensitivities such as dairy, gluten, lactose
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚Ä¢ Ulcerative colitis
‚Ä¢ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚Ä¢ Eczema
‚Ä¢ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions 

mySymptoms is also useful for recording a FODMAP diet.


Please note that the analysis algorithms use statistical methods to identify suspect foods/items and do not understand your diet or specific health circumstances. 


The information provided by this app is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor if you have any concerns about your health. Always consult a licensed health professional prior to modifying your diet.


GO PREMIUM

‚Ä¢ Advanced analysis including ingredients and food groups (where provided)
‚Ä¢ Detailed results for each item includes more specific information, a histogram and trend chart 
‚Ä¢ Review events a food or symptom appears in
‚Ä¢ No adverts


mySymptoms also provides a list of common symptoms for food intolerance, IBS, IBD and Crohn's, but you can add extra symptoms as required.


Terms: http://mysymptoms.net/terms


NOTE: mySymptoms Food Diary currently supports portrait orientation only.


SUPPORT

If you experience any issues with mySymptoms, then please contact our support team - we will do our utmost to resolve the issue as soon as possible. Thanks!

support@skygazerlabs.com

MORE INFORMATION

Web: www.mysymptoms.net
Twitter: twitter.com/mysymptoms
Facebook: fb.me/mySymptoms
Enquiries: hello@mysymptoms.net

recentChanges: + Fix for file export on Android 10
comments: I just downloaded this app but I already love it! I love that it doesn't count calories and focuses on the way food makes you feel instead. I'm also loving every other category that you can track, like energy level, medication, environment, and mood. This is going to be so helpful with managing my chronic illness! Thank you to the developer! If I continue to use it I am for sure buying premium!

Paid premium, and didn't recieve. Sending questions and suggestions via email, and Facebook. No answer because they are closed on weekends. This is a useful app, for people suffering from gut issues caused by foods. They really need to add nutrition info to the diary because those with gastroparesis need to eat less fiber and not more. I have not found an app where the amount of fiber is customizable. And for this app, it would be appropriate.

Really good set up, easy to use. I like it a lot. I can log any food ingredients that I eat, the time and date, my mood at the time, and any symptoms I get, and much more. A very good diary to log my food and drink intake.

Once you've got your regular entries in its really quick to use. I like the range of options available. Mealtimes, exercise, mood, environment, sleep etc. Finding it really useful, plus I can send a report to my GP. üòä
This is the best app I could have found to help me focus on my eating and health. I like the flexibility of being able to write notes for entries and to add symptoms. I highly recommend to others.

title: GIThrive
description:
**Free version has limited features only. GIThrive is an employer-sponsored digestive health program. To experience full benefits, talk to your HR department at work.**

Better health, gut first. GIThrive makes it simple and even fun to gain control over your GI symptoms, even the worst ones. With gut health secrets your doctor hasn't shared (or maybe doesn't even know about yet), this app empowers YOU with the research-based insight to get your gut right. Whether you're managing IBD, IBS, celiac, or GERD or, like most Americans, struggle with annoying digestive symptoms on a regular basis, GIThrive can help:

Personalized nutrition
Cutting-edge science
Fun and engaging daily activities, articles, and courses
24/7/365 support from a team of gut health experts
on-demand help to quickly manage and ease symptom flares

GIThrive is developed by Vivante Health, the digestive health experts.

title: FODMAP Helper - Diet Companion
description:
FODMAP Helper - Diet Companion
This app makes identification of high and low FODMAP foods easier to help you with your FODMAP friendly diet. This can be helpful in reducing symptoms for people with IBS, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Crohn's disease, Colitis, Lactose Intolerance and various other food intolerances, food sensitivities, and stomach problems.

Features include:
- Comprehensive list of foods and whether or not they are low FODMAP foods, to make finding foods that won't exacerbate your IBS easier.
- Search by food name and category.
- General FODMAP Diet and Irritable Bowel Syndrome, IBS, Crohn's disease, Colitis, and - 
- Lactose Intolerence and other food sensitivities info.
- Additional details on the specific breakdowns of each food and whether it is high, medium, or low in the main categories of Polyols, Oligos, Fructose, and Lactose.


Premium Features Include:
My Experience - Log your personal experience with foods to determine if a food works for you regardless of its FODMAP content. Rate whether you had a good or bad reaction to a food after eating it, then leave detailed notes so that you know for next time how said food will affect you.

Community Experience - See how the community has reacted to a food via anonymized My Experience ratings. This will let you know if the majority of users of the app had a good or bad reaction to a food.

My Experience and Community Experience data analysis - Advanced graphs and data analysis present the my experience and community experience data to you in a useful and intuitive format to show you breakdowns of good and bad reactions to the various food categories as well as what your worst foods are.

Challenge - The FODMAP Diet is an elimination diet for IBS, GI diseases, and food sensitivities. Once you've eliminated all high FODMAP foods from your diet, you can challenge foods to determine if they work for you. This lets you introduce these foods back into your regular meals one at a time and track your experience with each food after three days to determine if it will work in your FODMAP friendly diet. More details on challenges are contained within the app.

About FODMAPs and IBS
FODMAPs are short chain carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed in the small intestine, especially for people with Irritable Bowel Syndrome, IBS, Crohn's disease, Colitis, Lactose Intolerance, Gluten Intolerance, other food intolerances and stomach sensitivities. They include short chain oligo-saccharide polymers of fructose and galactooligosaccharides, disaccharides (lactose), monosaccharides (fructose), and sugar alcohols (polyols).

The term is an acronym, derived from:

*Fermentable
*Oligo-
*Di-
*Mono-saccharides
*And
*Polyols 

Although these specific carbs are naturally present in the foods we eat, diet restriction has been found to improve symptom control in people with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and other functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGID), such as Lactose Intolerance, Gluten Intolerance, Crohn's disease, Colitis, and other stomach sensitivities. Prior to the formation of the FODMAP concept, diet was seldom used as first line therapy for management of IBS, Crohn's, Colitis, Lactose intolerance and other FGID.

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a group of symptoms‚Äîincluding abdominal pain and changes in bowel movement patterns without evidence of underlying damage. The main symptoms of IBS are abdominal pain, discomfort in association with frequent diarrhea or constipation and a change in bowel habits.


DISCLAIMER:
We do not perform any testing ourselves. All compiled data should be used as guidelines not as basis of fact. Consult your physician before beginning any new diet. This general information is not intended to diagnose any medical condition or to replace the advice of your healthcare professional.

comments: It would be nice if it included more for free but the search option is really handy and seems very accurate!

Premium features cost more than the Apple App store version... Shouldn't that be the opposite? But let's be serious for what this app offers which is just to give info from a list already done Monash FODMAP. Even the Monash FODMAP app is reasonably price.
At the moment, I only have the free functions, but it is easy to look up low fodmap foods.
Much easier to use and the big printed list I had. Well done.
An excellent app it offers quality information quickly.

title: Low FODMAP diet A to Z food list for IBS sufferers
description:
This app was created by a software developer with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who found the low FODMAP diet to be very effective in avoiding trigger foods. It includes the following key features:

‚úì Clear and simple FODMAP rating system
‚úì Database of 600+ everyday foods and ingredients
‚úì Breakdown of each FODMAP rating (showing oligos, fructose, polyols and lactose content) 
‚úì Search by food name and filter by category/rating to find exactly what you want

If you have IBS and are following the low FODMAP diet to improve your digestive health by avoiding trigger foods then this A to Z food list is for you.

Note: this app is provided for educational purposes only; please ensure you seek the advice of a qualified doctor before making changes to your diet.

Added tomatillo to the food list.

Thanks to everyone who has provided feedback for the list! Please keep it coming to fodmapaz@gmail.com
comments: Fantastic app. This has made my life so much easier. I do t need to keep looking up food on Google to find out whether it's good to eat. Very clear and easy to understand. Gives you 2 weight allowance amounts as well as red, green or amber. Highly reccomend

This app is super great! I can easily look up food and check if they are low fodmap, in addition to what exactly it has (like oligos, fructose, etc). What could make this even better, is the possibility to look up items such as snacks that are low fodmap.
Great App. Makes looking things up quick and easy. Gives safe serving sizes of items and what FODMAPs they contain. Hope to see many more items added in the future.
Our needs are different. Each person has different problems, let's face it IBS covers a huge range of problems. Great guide. I have one question, whats the little cross for ?
Easy quick way to check safe vs risky foods, with explanation for classification; still a work in the making with missing information

title: Zemedy - IBS, Gut Relief (CBT, Poop,Tracker, Diet)
description:
With a fresh new look and a string of new features, a newly-updated Zemedy is here!

Zemedy is a digital care programme built to empower individuals with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) to self-manage their condition. With a little help from a virtual chatbot, Mel, Zemedy guides you through your personalised care journey and helps you change the way you address IBS-related symptoms using clinically-proven insights and analytics. Zemedy‚Äôs integrated approach keeps time-consuming doctor visits and therapy costs to a minimum.

Developed alongside clinical experts, Zemedy integrates evidence-based, highly effective psychological therapies for IBS, including cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) and gut-directed hypnotherapy. Zemedy also leverages the latest medical research that‚Äôs packed with know-how from our science team in gastroenterology, nutrition, psychology, and neuroscience.

title: Bowel Stomach Pain & IBS Diet stomach indigestion
description:
Bowel Stomach Pain & IBS Diet Tips is a Free App for android mobile devices that provides all diet tips and help information about Irritable bowel syndrome. IBS is also called spastic colon and it is An intestinal disorder causing pain in the stomach wind diarrhoea and constipation etc problems.

IBS or Irritable bowel syndrome is a functional gastrointestinal disorder that affects the large intestine called colon. It is related to increased sensitivity of the gut and problems digesting food. Irritable bowel syndrome commonly causes cramping abdominal pain bloating gas diarrhea and constipation. Cramps and abdominal pain make everyday activities unbearable. 

People with IBS have symptoms that can include:

* Diarrhea (violent episodes of diarrhea)
* Constipation 
* Constipation alternating with diarrhea
* unwanted weight loss
* insomnia
* Belly pains or cramps, usually in the lower half of the belly, that get worse after meals and feel better after a bowel movement
* A lot of gas or bloating
* noisy stomach
* Harder or looser stools than normal
* Some people also have urinary and sexual problems

The condition can be painful and debilitating, which can have a negative impact on your quality of life and emotional state but With appropriate medical and psychological treatment, you should be able to live a normal, full and active life with IBS.

People suffering from IBS disease usually suffer with stress and anxiety but Change in daily diet and lifestyle may help cope with the situation. 
Certain foods can help IBS, but everyone is different. Examine your symptoms and talk to your doctor before starting a new diet.

title: myColitis
descriptionHTML:
Record your bowel movements, medications, meals, moods, symptoms, tests and more related to your overall health in a few seconds. No longer struggle with entering or tracking data again! Great for Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis (UC), inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), or if you just want to better understand your health. With a unique bowel movement discomfort calculation, and insights into your data you will start to make correlations you never before thought of.

Simple, clean and easy to track with a few taps. ¬†It takes seconds to enter, and it will become a habit to track your health. ¬†The insights you gained will help you take control of your condition.

FEATURING

+ DIARY; showing today's entries, or anytime in the past
+ TRACK; bowel movements, medications, meals, moods, procedures, and tests related to your overall health;
+ QUICK; With a few taps, and in seconds you can record your data and move on with your day;
+ RECORD; the foods you eat and any reactions triggered;
+ MONITOR; your bowel movements;
+ NOTIFICATIONS; to take medications on time;
+ REPORTS; Showing statistics for your entered data;
+ GRAPHS; tracking bowel movement difficulty, pain, and more to see if your improving;
+ INSIGHTS; offering unique reporting and correlations between data;
+ EXPORT; your data to excel. Be in control of your health and share with your doctors;
+ REFERENCE; charts for stool type, pain scale and more to better understand data being tracked;

COMING SOON
- Export in PDF
- Additional Reports
- Additional Graphs
summary: Health Tracking Made Easy
developerAddress: 8549 Fennell Street Mission BC
recentChanges:
Minor bug fixes.

IMPORTANT Before updating please make a back-up Settings --> Manage Data --> Export Data;
Please contact us if you have any trouble exporting your data.

Sincerely,
Your gut-friendly team at myColitis
comments: This is a really great idea, it has loads of tracking options that I just love. But it has some bugs that mean I can't retrospectively add things, for example if I go to bed exhausted and haven't remembered to track my dinner that evening, I can't add it the next day. It also doesn't allow me to add ingredients that are not included on its surprisingly restricted list of ingredients. Overall, wonderful idea but the execution needs work.

The app does a decent job of tracking bowel movements, diet, and medicine. I have noted several issues and sent reports to the app developers. I have received no response. The preset medicine doses will sometimes double or quadruple in your queue and past medical history. I have on prescription that shows up eight times a day when I only take it once a day. Also if you add a duplicate food item you cannot delete it. And the ingredient options and search feature is extremely limited.

Although this is a good app and it is headed in the right direction I find it not as easy or simple to use as other meal or health logging apps. I have my medications listed in the app but I'd like to be able to log if I have had them or not, it's handy to look back and see when I forgot my medication and how it affected me. I find the coloured backgrounds also make it harder to read. And I'd like to see more auto immune flammatory symptoms listed that are connected. E.g., sore back, dermatitis.

Absolutely amazing, thank you so incredibly much for developing (& continuing to improve) this app...it has been a real game changer for me. I've tried many versions of food logs and wellness apps over the years but nothing compares to the insight I have gained through the easy and intuitive design of this application. Tracking my health doesn't feel like a chore anymore!!

I use it to track my bowel movements everyday. It's very helpful for when I have doctors appointments or test/procedures done because when they ask how many times a day I go or about my bleeding and what not all the information is there on my phone and completely accurate because it's recorded. It's also nice because I can remember when I've had scopes or blood tests too because it also tracks that.

title: Fast FODMAP Lookup & Learn (for IBS sufferers)
description:
** The #1 rated FODMAP and IBS app for IPhone is now available for Android **

The fastest way to look up which foods are High, Low or Medium FODMAP foods. 8x faster than the Monash University app*.

The best way to learn and remember which foods have High, Low or Medium FODMAPs. Using modern space repetition learning games to train your brain is fun and effective.

The lookup function focuses on just SPEED and ACCURACY. The two things that matter most when you are trying to follow a low FODMAP lifestyle. As soon as the app launches you can start typing and see the results as you type (an idiom called incremental searching). Looking up a food item should not be a pain, it should be FAST and EFFORTLESS.

We have found that decreasing effort and friction to lookup foods leads to more lookups per user and greater knowledge and more FODMAP friendly dietary choices.  

* Our studies have shown that Fast FODMAP Lookup has, on average, an 8 fold reduction in elapsed time to locate a food's overall FODMAP level.  

Other benefits over the Monash App:
- It works offline (Search)
- Faster and more intuitive diary
- Powerful weekly meal planner
- Link with your dietitian for personalized feedback
- It is gratis for you

"A must have app for IBS sufferers"

comments: This is a great app! It keeps me on track as I'm needing to be on the fodmaps diet. Easy to look up foods to see if I'm allowed to eat them. I like recording my feelings and bowel movements. It helps me keep notes so that I have them to discuss with my doctor. Using this app. Has helped me stay in control and as a result my digestive issues have improved tremendously.

Thank you for making a free app to track FODMAP. I've recently been struggling with IBS (ah the curse of aging). This app has really helped me avoid foods that are difficult to digest (high FODMAP). Useful tool to look up high and low foods....really great for the elimination phase of the diet. My favorite feature is the "diary" section; you can track what you eat throughout the day and how those foods make you feel. Since using this app I have had far less gas and less stomach cramps.

Only just started to use this App and there is so much in it. So far am loving it, even has quiz games where you can learn which foods are high, medium and low in Fodmaps. The Diary is great too with little reminders to fill in after meals tracking what you have eaten and how you feel. The extensive bank of foods makes it easy to check out foods, you get an instant answer too. I see there is a meditation section, but haven't got that far yet, so much in this little Ap and it's free too.

App is ready to use and I like that it lets you record so much so I can really keep track of how what I eat effects me. It does run really quickly too. I have the Google Pixel 4 and have not experienced any lag with the app, from opening it to using it.

I'm currently waiting for appointment with dietitian, but thought I'd get a feel for what the diet involves. This has been brilliant. Not everything is on here, but it gives you what you guidance as you're shopping. You can log meals, snacks, exercise, set goals, (even stools) and personalise with images and affirmations. Highly recommend with this complex diet.

title: All Stomach Diseases and Treatment
description:
All stomach diseases and treatment A-Z
This app provides information on gastrointestinal diseases, digestive system diseases and stomach health tips. This medical book will provide you with proper  information on intestinal diseases, home remedies and natural cures for simple cases such as acidity.

Stomach diseases and treatment app contains detailed information, high quality pictures and diagrams  for all the diseases.The app is simple to use and does not require internet connection to function.
Some of the details explained in this medical book are the signs and symptoms of each stomach disease, diagnosis and treatment ,prevention measures and outlook.Some disorders like Celiac disease (autoimmune disease) is a medical emergency since it damages the small intestine lining. Always seek medical help from a qualified physician when you don't feel well.
This app can be used by doctors,medical assistant,therapist, students and patients as a source of information.
Do not experiment anything without the advice of a skilled clinical officer.The app only provides information on stomach and intestinal diseases and not the clinical practice guidelines.
Learn about the digestive system  in order to have a clear picture of how this stomach diseases destroy all humans digestive system.e.g.How celiac disease destroy the human small intestine lining and how to have a gluten free diet plan.This disease condition app provides all communicable and non communicable disease conditions and treatment.
This clinical diagnosis and treatment book can help prevent brain problems by providing you with  info about the brain eater stomach/intestinal worms.However, if it's late to prevent you just need to visit your doctor for  treatment.

Infection Diseases like appendicitis may require surgical procedures for removal of the spoiled appendix.We do not provide any surgical procedures like appendix surgery but we do state it.

Seek for medical emergency treatment from a qualified doctor if you have severe abdominal pain which is not relieved by over the counter drugs(OTC Medicine).Some digestive system diseases like typhoid fever which is caused by salmonella bacteria and other gastrointestinal diseases can threaten your mental health due to brain damage. On rare occasions, these infections can affect the brain resulting in serious neurological symptoms such as slurred speech and lack of muscle control.

Take note that this app cannot tell what you are sufffering from. It can only  give reliable information on varies cases. 
Diseases include:
*Celiac disease - Diagnosis and Treatment - easy gluten free recipes - gluten free diet plan
*Appendicitis
*Barrett's esophagus
*Colon Cancer
*Bloating
*Consipation - constipation remedies
*Crohn's disease
*Cyclic vomiting syndrome
*diarrhea
*Diverticulitis
*Esophageal cancer
*Gastritis
*Gastroparesis
*Acid reflux diet - acid reflux during pregnancy
*Food poisoning
*Gallstones
*Ulcerative colitis diet
*Irritable bowel syndrome(IBS)
*Hemorrhoids test and hemorrhoids treatment
*Diverticulitis treatment
*Indigestion
*Lactose intolerance - lactose intolerance diet
*Stomach cancer
*Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
*Preventing infection at home
Stomach cancer and colon cancer cause digestion problem and affect digestion and absorption and may require intestine surgery for cure.
If you have a query please contact us via our official email: patrikatsoftech@gmail.com

title: FoodView: Easy photo food diary
description:
FoodView aims to make keeping a photo food diary as quick & simple as possible. There is no calorie tracking, barcode scanning or manual data entry. 

We hope that keeping a food diary will help you be more aware of what you're eating & drinking and help you short-circuit habits that you'd like to break.

A food diary can also come in handy when discussing nutrition with doctors, dietitians or other healthcare professionals. By quickly giving them an accurate picture of your food intake you will hopefully be better placed to get useful advice and spend less appointment time answering food intake questions.

There are no ads & we care about your privacy - photos are not sent anywhere unless you share them. In the future premium features may be added - such as securely sharing photos via an online portal and getting advice from dietitians.

Demo photo credits: https://www.foodview.app/screenshots.html

comments: Simple way to log what and when you are consuming! Just snap a photo or add an existing one, and you can leave a note with it for now description. Easily change the time stamp of needed, and turn on/off or adjust notifications. Developer support response is amazing, constantly working on improvements and actually communicates! I highly recommend!

After trying several text-based food diary apps, I was so happy to find FoodView! Quick and simply to make entries, and you see exactly what you are eating with one click instead of fiddling with descriptions and icons etcetera. Also on a mindfulness note, the photos encourage me to make an effort preparing each meal so that it looks attractive (I'm a lazy cook) as well as to slow down and pause before starting my meal üôèüèª Thanks dev!

Very simple app but it's exactly what I'm looking for. I've always wanted to keep track of my food deliveries during quarantine using photos, and this app lets me do just that. "Automatic date and time" makes posting so easy. I love it. My only comment is that it says "out of range" when I try to edit an entry's date. I hope that can be fixed. But anyways, big thank you to the devs! Fantastic job.

Best meal tracking app there is! It's incredibly simple and makes for an easy overview of your meals. No calorie counting! Not even a place to track the calories or macros. It's a dream come true for a person in recovery who still needs to track food intake. Thank you devs.
Keep it simple, Listen to your user survey, this app will useful for many people

title: Gastrointestinal USMLE S2CK QA
description:
Get +1300 Questions & answers  and prepare your Gastrointestinal   USMLE step 2 CK exam in less time and get better understanding and higher score. It's the only Gastrointestinal exam questions Bank on the android market.
Our passion to Gastrointestinal  drove us to develop this outstanding android application to help you understand and admire Gastrointestinal .

This app is intended to  students, researchers, resident, doctors, Gastrointestinal  specialists, nurses and  medical professionals and of course Medical lecturers, teachers and professors.
Get a better score in your  USMLE  (step1, step2  CS & CK), PANCE, MCAT, DAT, COMLEX, OAT, NBDE,  or PCAT exam, City and Guilds (AMSPAR) Certificates in Medical Terminology and CMA (AAMA) Medical Terminology Exams. Includes links to free interactive medical apps.
Suitable for premedical students, nursing students, medical secretaries, transcriptionists, and allied health students, in fact anyone with an interest in the language of medicine or medical education, and the most important  is to fall in love with the material, it worth all the attention.

The human gastrointestinal tract, or GI tract, or GIT is an organ system responsible for consuming and digesting foodstuffs, absorbing nutrients, and expelling waste.

The tract consists of the stomach and intestines, and is divided into the upper and lower gastrointestinal tracts. However, by the broadest definition, the GI tract includes all structures between the mouth and the anus. On the other hand, the digestive system is a broader term that includes other structures, including the digestive organs and their accessories. The tract may also be divided into foregut, midgut, and hindgut, reflecting the embryological origin of each segment.

The whole digestive tract is about nine metres (30 feet) long.

Disease

There are a number of diseases and conditions affecting the gastrointestinal system, including:

    Infection. Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the intestines. It occurs more frequently than any other disease of the intestines.
    Cancer may occur at any point in the gastrointestinal tract, and includes mouth cancer, tongue cancer, oesophageal cancer, stomach cancer, and colorectal cancer.
    Inflammatory conditions. Ileitis is an inflammation of the ileum, Colitis is an inflammation of the large intestine.
    Appendicitis is inflammation of the vermiform appendix located at the caecum. This is a potentially fatal condition if left untreated; most cases of appendicitis require surgical intervention.

Diverticular disease is a condition that is very common in older people in industrialized countries. It usually affects the large intestine but has been known to affect the small intestine as well. Diverticulosis occurs when pouches form on the intestinal wall. Once the pouches become inflamed it is known as diverticulitis.

Inflammatory bowel disease is an inflammatory condition affecting the bowel walls, and includes the subtypes Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis. While Crohn's can affect the entire gastrointestinal tract, ulcerative colitis is limited to the large intestine. 

Several symptoms are used to indicate problems with the gastrointestinal tract:

    Vomiting, 
    Diarrhoea, 
    Constipation, 
    Blood in stool, 


Various methods of imaging the gastrointestinal tract are used:

    Radioopaque dyes may be swallowed to produce a Barium swallow
 
    An abdominal x-ray may be used to examine the lower gastrointestinal tract.

Other

    Celiac Disease
    Cholera
    Diarrhoea
    Enteric duplication cyst
    Giardiasis
    Irritable bowel syndrome
    Pancreatitis
    Peptic ulcer disease
    Yellow Fever
    Helicobacter pylori is a gram-negative spiral bacterium.

title: Endive - IBS FODMAP Food Diary & Symptoms Tracker
description:
Simply track what you eat, your symptoms and moods and Endive will help you identify correlations in a visual graph form.

Food is a common trigger of digestive symptoms. Avoiding certain foods or keeping a low FODMAP diet can dramatically improve issues like gas, bloating, stomach pain, diarrhoea, constipation and others.

However, everyone is different and there is no one-size-fits-all IBS diet: Keeping a diary of what you eat and how you feel is vital to learning what triggers your symptoms.

Take charge of your digestion and gut health.

üìâPERSONALISED TRACKER 
Add custom foods and symptoms that are personal to you and track them together with the others. Endive knows recipes and breaks them down into ingredients to make IBS tracking faster and more efficient.

If you have a condition you know about, but want to optimise your diet to help improve your symptoms, Endive helps you keep track of what you have eaten and how you feel, both physically and psychologically. This allows you to learn how your body reacts to different foods ü•ë, or which triggers (e.g. anxiety, depression) are causing you symptoms.

üìäWIDE RANGING TRACKER

Endive helps you manage conditions such as:

‚úÖ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚úÖ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚úÖ Food intolerance and sensitivities (such as Dairy, Wheat/Gluten, Lactose)
‚úÖ Acid reflux
‚úÖ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚úÖ Coeliac disease
‚úÖ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚úÖ Ulcerative colitis
‚úÖ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚úÖ Skin issues (such as Eczema, Acne)
‚úÖ Period / menstrual cycle related issues
‚úÖ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions

üî¨FODMAP TRACKER
Want to track your FODMAP diet? üçí
FODMAP‚Äôs are types of carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed by the body. Studies show strong links between them and digestive IBS symptoms. A low FODMAP diet can have remarkable benefits if you struggle with these issues.

If you want to take your tracking to the next level, get weekly reports with Endive Plus that highlight high and low FODMAP foods in your diet so you can learn which of them might have caused your symptoms.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

We'd love to hear your thoughts üí≠

üí°Send your questions, feedback and bug reports to feedback@endive.app

comments: Helpful for keeping track of food and symptoms but definitely not an app for a newbie. New to having to keep an eye on FODMAPS so wish it was easier to see which was what. There is the ability to pay for highlighting of this but I didn't find the highlights were on each food item. As well, the food options assume you're making things from scratch. Or some searches food items just didn't result in anything and I had to manually add each ingredient. Definitely not gonna be doing that takes forever

I've used several apps to track my IBS-C. I know the developer is still working on this app, but so far I like it. They have a great selection of food items and recipes already in the database. You can easily adjust the recipes, too. After every entry it asks you to rate your triggers (bloating, constipation, etc) which I LOVE! I'm so bad about tracking those. There is no export option yet, which I hope comes soon. Using the free version and there are no ads, either.

Found this app really disappointing. The high/low fodmap scoring is behind a paywall. Additionally I lost confidence in the food directory, hardly any of the meals I get from the supermarket are in the directory.
User experience is just really cluttered. I looked for my regular low fodmap items in the meal directory and could not find any of them. Going to keep looking for a helpful fodmap food diary
I use it for my IBS and how bloated I am etc good reminder.

title: Dietary Fiber Food Sources help heart skin weight
description:
Dietary Fiber Foods guide is a free app about foods fruits & vegetables diets for people of all ages showing the list of great High Fiber foods that you must eat for Healthy Gut Intestines Health & weight loss. We have compiled all type of high Fiber food sources suitable for your daily diet.
	
Dietary fiber also known as roughage is important for body and has a number of health benefits. It helps in Lowering cholesterol levels, thus, reducing risk of heart disease. A fiber rich diet helps in maintain blood sugar levels & controlling diabetes. Fiber Normalizes bowel movements thus relieving constipation, and help tremendously in achieving healthy body weight. Besides this it plays vital roles in preventing Breast cancer Peptic ulcer Inflammatory bowel disease kidney & gall bladder stones and Hypertension etc.

Fiber adds bulk to your diet and makes you feel full faster, helping you control your weight. Insoluble Fiber bulks up stools and makes waste move through the digestive tract more quickly, which is better for the gut. 

Good sources of dietary fiber include
* Whole grain cereals 
* pulses and legumes
* Nuts and seeds
* Fruit and vegetables

Eating the skin or peel of fruits and vegetables provides a greater dose of fiber, which is found naturally in these sources which helps in lowering blood pressure, inflammation, improve levels of HDL (good) cholesterol, shed excess weight and improves health & appearance of skin by flushing out harmful toxins. 

Caution: Fiber absorbs water from within your body so it is necessary to drink plenty of fluids if you increase the amount of fibrous foods in your daily diet. Suddenly including too much dietary fiber in your diet can cause side effects like gas, bloating, colic and cramps Adding fiber gradually and drinking enough fluids and water can help avoiding these problems.

title: Natural Colon Cleanse
description:
Feeling fatigue, stress, and pain in your guts? That might be your colon crying for help! Everything you need to know on how to make a natural cleanse can be found right here! 

Colon or large intestine is the part of digestive system responsible for the re-absorption of water and salts from solid waste formed after digestion, before it gets eliminated from the body.

In some people the build-up of harmful waste in the intestine occurs due to malfunctioning of the colon. This build-up of waste causes the toxins in the waste to enter into the walls of the intestine.

When this part of the intestine becomes less active it affects the elimination of wastes from the digestive system. It‚Äôs time for a natural cleanse. The main reasons for this low activity or malfunction are:

‚Ä¢    Poor diet
‚Ä¢    Lack of exercise
‚Ä¢    Stress
‚Ä¢    Reduced water intake
‚Ä¢    Drug intake
‚Ä¢    Lifestyle

A natural cleansing can help improve your body‚Äôs overall health and wellness, and may even reduce your risks for colon cancer.

If you have symptoms such as: Headache, Vomiting, Bloating, Low energy level, Irritable bowel, Unexplained fatigue, Weight gain, Protruding belly, etc. Then you need to start working on that cleansing!

Luckily here we have put together a handful of information that‚Äôll help you achieve that healthy state that you deserve and desire! Just download this app and start your Natural Colon cleansing today!

title: Foody - Food & Symptom Tracker
description:
Foody is your personal diary for keeping track of your food and symptoms you may experience from it. Once used for a couple of days Foody lets you analyze your diet and symptoms to assist you in understanding your health. The more you record, the better Foody can help you analyzing it. Therefor it was designed with focus on ease of use and simplicity rather than complicated forms. 

‚óä Record your Food
- Mark your meals as breakfast, lunch, dinner or just snacks and drinks in between.
- Solid food and drinks are separted for or a better overview. 
- No need to guess amounts or what not.
- Add unlimited ingredients for dishes and drinks.
- Add notes to your meals to include as mush details as you need.

‚óä Record Symptoms 
- Add symptoms by a concise title
- Use the intensity to keep track of how symptoms evolve.
- Add notes to include as mush details as you need to.

‚óä Input Helper
Entering the same over and over again is cumbersome. Foody helps you with a custom prediction. It suggests your most used symptoms, foods, drinks and even ingredients so entering common items is only a matter of seconds. 

‚óä Timeline / Overview 
- View and modify your diary entries in a beautiful timeline. 
- Apply filters to analyze and check any suspicion. 
- Filter to display only a custom period / date range.
- Filter food based on meal type and search term. 
- Choose to hide symptoms or filter by search term. 

‚óä Furthermore 
- No setup required: Foody is ready to record right away. No need to sign up, fill out stuff or create catalogs before. 
- All on your device: Everything is stored only on your device. No Cloud is involved at all. 
- Fully Offline: Since everything happens on your device without internet connection, it works where ever you go.

PLEASE NOTE: Foody is free to download and try out including all features. However, there are limitations which need to be unlocked once via In-App purchase for a serious use.

Schudomastr. 26A
12055 Berlin
Germany
recentChanges: bug fixing
comments: Does the job. No frills (even though it could use a few) I bought the app, which seemed priced appropriately for what it does. I do hope to see some updates, maybe icon choices between breakfast, lunch and dinner to better distinguish between the three instead of the same icon. Maybe a choice of colors. A little bit would go a long way to making this app great.

A simple app for logging meals, with a pleasing design. But there should be a way to set the time to 12H instead of 24H. For instance my entry may say 2:15 PM, but when viewing the diary feed it's listed as 14:15. There are no settings or preferences. Also agree with another reviewer that a calendar view for jumping to specific days would be nice.

The free version only gives you a 7 day history. I'm in the middle of unpleasant intolerance symptoms so seeing my logs is imperative and my health depends on it. I don't want to bounce between a lot of apps or reenter info across them. Please consider another barrier, even ads. If I remember this app I might consider trying it when I'm not feeling sick, but this app is designed for sick people, so... It's a bummer because the interface is nice and you can't go wrong with googly eyes.
I downloaded it for the symptoms too, but there isnt a calendar view, and it only records 7 days before asking for a lot of money. I had to uninstall.

I use this to track my baby's symptoms as I am still breastfeeding and it works really well. I can add and edit things that I forgot and it's nice to have a scale of how bad the symptoms were for each event. The only thing I would love to see to improve it would be some sort of graph or chart as part of the report showing any patterns instead of having to read back through all of my entries to see if I can find any links.

title: Remedies for IBS
description:
IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome), colitis, crohn's disease, Acid Reflux, Diverticulitis, leaky gut syndrome, all of these entire specific medical terms direct towards the deterioration of tissues in the abdominal region. But few people know that using natural cures and herbal remedies can bring about a welcome change and can rebuild these naturally occurring tissues slowly but steadily. I am not so sure about the medical prescriptions being functioning or not, but Herbal Remedies for IBS, Natural Cures for Colitis, Natural Remedies for Acid Reflux, Natural Diverticulitis Treatment work wonders on the body and cures these type of medical conditions permanently.

Usually the one which undergoes abrasion during such medical condition is the mucous membrane. I know it might sound like technical jargon but these mucous membranes are made up of the membrane wall and the mucosal lining. Using naturally occurring herbs, amino acids and fatty acids the right way, one can successfully rebuild the mucous membranes. In contrast to artificially developed and chemically laced medications, natural and herbal remedies have no side effects (and by no we mean no short term or long term side effects what so ever) and there is entirely no connection with medication.

One thing you ought to know is strong emotions and even stress can affect your colon badly thereby making the IBS a real pain in the abdominal section. Some of the habits which you ought to drop or at least restrain yourself from are: - large meals which will fill you up to the brim, strong medications (specifically if you are trying out Herbal Remedies for IBS or IBS treatment), Bloating from gas in the colon, caffeine induced drinks such as tea, coffee and soft drinks, over dosage of alcohol, chocolate, wheat, barley, rye or even milk products, constant worry, inconsistency, or emotional upsets. These are some of the common things which you should avoid at any cost if you believe that your body is showing symptoms of Irritable Bowel Syndrome.

Especially women with Irritable Bowel Syndrome show symptoms at a higher level and frequency during their regular menstrual periods. This fact also suggests that reproductive hormones in particular aggravate the problems associated with Irritable Bowel Syndrome. When it comes for you to look into IBS Treatment or Diverticulitis Treatment, you should chip in for someone who is expert at Natural or Herbal Remedies for IBS. You can even chip in for Natural Cures for Acid Reflux or Natural Cures for Colitis.

Download the app to know more..

Simple and organized; has a user-friendly interface! A very helpful app!

title: Poop Tracker - Toilet Log, Bowel Movement Analysis
description:
Track and analyse your bowel movements easily with Poop Tracker, then print out your stool analysis to quickly and easily share this data with your doctor.

Ever wonder what your bowel movements mean and how they affect your health? Curious to find out how frequently you suffer from bowel conditions like constipation, diarrhea, or bloody stool? Well now tracking your bowel movements is easier than ever. 

Find out what consistency, color, frequency, and urgency means for your health by tracking and analyzing these stats over time, then use that data to determine if any issues, such as IBS, or crohn's are present.

Poop Tracker uses the Bristol Stool Scale to determine the quality of your poop and allows you to track and analyze your bowel movement data across all of your log entries.

Poop Tracker features include:

- Easily and quickly log every poop you take.

- Track poop stats like colour, Stool type (Bristol Stool Scale), urgency, size, bloody stool, pain, and custom notes. These metrics can be important to determine if you have any bowel problems such as diarrhea, constipation, ibs (irritable bowel syndrome), colitis, crohn's disease or any other chronic condition.

- Log 'No Poop' days and leave custom notes when you're constipated.

- View and modify previous poop log entries with our comprehensive calendar view of your stool history.

- Export or Import a CSV data file of all of your stool entries so your data can be saved and restored, or sent to your healthcare provider.

- View a data breakdown and graph of your stool statistics over time including metrics like when your bowel movements happen and a day by day history (premium feature).


Why track your bowel movements?

Tracking bowel movements can be a useful tool to gauge your stool health over time and potentially uncover any chronic problems you might have such as: IBS (Irritable bowel syndrome), Crohn's disease, Colitis, Celiac disease, Chronic Diarrhea, or Constipation by noticing patterns and irregularities in your stool that you may not have noticed otherwise.


If you already suffer from a chronic bowel condition, you can also benefit from maintaining a poop log as it allows you to monitor the severity of your symptoms and progression of these life altering diseases over time and share this data quickly and easily with your doctor.


About the Bristol Stool Scale:

The Bristol stool scale, or BSF scale is a diagnostic medical tool designed to classify the form of human stool into seven categories. It is used in both clinical and experimental fields. It is sometimes referred to in the UK as the Meyers scale. This is the scale used to track 'Type' in Poop Tracker because it is the most developed standard in many countries for categorizing feces.

recentChanges: + Hotfixed visual bug that was affecting the homepage on older versions of Android
comments: I like it. I was going to delete it to be honest. But when I started to look for a replacement I couldn't find one that was any better or even as good. I even cancelled my subscription but I think I am going to re-sub at the end of the month. The only thing I don't like is I find the analysis kind of complicated. I get a quicker picture of what's going on just looking at the calendar. Also what is the brown triangle in the right hand corner on some of my days in calendar?
Excellent app. Would be even better if there was somewhere to enter symptoms; stomach cramps, etc. Edit: Maybe include Symptoms, in the menu where Bowel Movement, and Medication, is? Thank you!
Easy to use and navigate. Been very handy keeping track of me. Just don't like you have to pay for full experiences

This app has been so useful for me. I have IBS and struggle with bowel movements and this is ideal being able to track what they're like and how close/far apart they are. The one thing I would change would be where you log movements as "urgent" or not, if there was blood and if there was pain I'd add a chart. It would be useful to know by looking back if a movement has a little blood, or a lot. If it was a lot painful or just a lite.

After my issues were addressed by the developers I'm glad to see improvement and interaction. However I still do not agree with the increase in price of the app since the application doesn't appear to use servers in order to function. It does work somewhat well,I just wish it had features for enema uses, adult diapers, and milliliters. But for the free version it does work.

title: Food and Symptoms Tracker - MoodBites IBS Diary
description:
MoodBites is the best food journal to track what you eat and how you feel

It is proven that the food we eat has a direct impact on how we feel. Many times, diseases such as depression, anxiety and inflammation have their roots in the food we eat. Autoimmune diseases and food allergies can not only have a significant impact on the quality of your life and health, but can also be very difficult to understand. MoodBites is meant to deal with this issue and help you learn exactly how the food you eat affects your mood and health. Tracking what you eat and how you feel couldn't be easier - you're just a few taps away from logging the foods you eat and the way you feel.

The food we eat decides whether we feel motivated, focused and sharp or lazy and foggy. Keeping track of how each individual food influences the way we feel can be difficult though - symptoms can even take days before emerging. This is why MoodBites is such an important tool in learning what effects food has on us. MoodBites will show you how the food that you ate changed your mood in the past and even in the future.

MoodBites Features:

- Simple to use: Logging what you eat and how you feel can be done in a few taps

- Smart food auto completion - save time when adding food

- In-depth mood logging: Describe exactly how you feel, both with mood ratings and symptoms

- Symptoms: Understand how the symptoms you experience are linked the food you eat

- Superior food logging: Track not only the food you eat, but also take notes about the quantity, ingredients, etc.

- Diary: Find out exactly how the food you ate affected you, both the day you ate it and for up to 7 days after you ate it

- Calendar: Easily get details about the food you ate and your moods every day

- Insights: Gain an in-depth understanding of how food affected you in the past

- Predictions: Predict how food will influence your mood in the future




 MoodBites does not collect information from the users! 

Credits:
Some graphics are taken from flaticon.com

If MoodBites has helped you live a better life please rate it and share it with the people you care about!

This is only my 2nd day with this but: 1) can't seem to insert a food that I forgot about into a prior time; 2) on my android (S7 Active) I can't see the "+" to Submit until I hit the Back key to remove the keyboard; and there was something else but I forgot what it was. App with a potential but need some work, I will gladly change my feedback if it improves :)
Everything is perfect, but when I received a notification for set my mood, I open it, but the notification still after I completed the input.

title: Nerva: IBS hypnotherapy relief from gut symptoms
description:
Nerva is the easiest way to manage your IBS symptoms at home, without symptom tracking or diet-change. Developed by doctors, Nerva helps you rewire your gut-brain connection with a 6-week psychology-based program.

Nerva uses the most effective psychological approach to IBS relief: gut-directed hypnotherapy. Clinically proven in a study at Monash University (creators of the low FODMAP diet), this approach was found to be just as effective as their gold-standard elimination diet for both food and stress-triggered symptoms.

How does it work? 

Gut-directed hypnotherapy can teach your brain how to ignore pain signals from your gut. Less signals, less flare-ups. You also learn powerful techniques that can help you manage flare-ups and take back control from IBS.

With Nerva, it can be possible to:
‚Ä¢ Eat the foods you love without worry
‚Ä¢ Be free from chronic pain and discomfort
‚Ä¢ Go to work and socialize with friends without fear and anxiety
‚Ä¢ Feel confident in your own skin with an un-bloated belly
‚Ä¢ Travel stress-free while not having to map out toilets or be worried about having an IBS flare-up
‚Ä¢ Enjoy a happy sex life without fear of embarrassment

"Halfway in and my symptoms have already improved dramatically which still blows my mind as I‚Äôve had no luck with other IBS treatments in the past." - Beverley.

"I am so improved.. like ridiculously and totally unexpectedly so much better! Even by the first week, I noticed a marked improvement in symptoms and it has continued to get better" - Jackie

What you get:
‚Ä¢ An evidence-based hypnotherapy program designed by a world-leading doctor to help you improve your IBS symptoms long-term
‚Ä¢ Interactive content with dozens of articles, guides & animations that help you reduce anxiety & stress
‚Ä¢ Intuitive streak tracking & to-do lists that keep you motivated and on-track
‚Ä¢ Tips & advice on how to enjoy a healthy gut and life
‚Ä¢ In-app chat support from real people

Nerva is a self-help & self-care tool that isn't a replacement for professional medical help. You should make sure to check with a doctor in addition to using the app and before making medical decisions.

Sign up today to finally take back control of your life from Irritable Bowel Syndrome with Nerva!

For more information, please see our Terms and Conditions: http://www.nervaibs.com/terms-and-conditions

Clinically proven in a study at Monash University (creators of the low FODMAP diet), this approach was found to be just as effective as their gold-standard elimination diet for both food and stress-triggered symptoms.

How does it work?

Gut-directed hypnotherapy can teach your brain how to ignore pain signals from your gut. Less signals, less flare-ups. You also learn powerful techniques that can help you manage flare-ups and take back control from IBS.

With Nerva, it can be possible to:
‚Ä¢ Eat the foods you love without worry
‚Ä¢ Be free from chronic pain and discomfort
‚Ä¢ Go to work and socialize with friends without fear and anxiety
‚Ä¢ Feel confident in your own skin with an un-bloated belly
‚Ä¢ Travel stress-free while not having to map out toilets or be worried about having an IBS flare-up
‚Ä¢ Enjoy a happy sex life without fear of embarrassment

"Halfway in and my symptoms have already improved dramatically which still blows my mind as I‚Äôve had no luck with other IBS treatments in the past." - Beverley.

"I am so improved.. like ridiculously and totally unexpectedly so much better! Even by the first week, I noticed a marked improvement in symptoms and it has continued to get better" - Jackie

What you get:
‚Ä¢ An evidence-based hypnotherapy program designed by a world-leading doctor to help you improve your IBS symptoms long-term
‚Ä¢ Interactive content with dozens of articles, guides & animations that help you reduce anxiety & stress
‚Ä¢ Intuitive streak tracking & to-do lists that keep you motivated and on-track
‚Ä¢ Tips & advice on how to enjoy a healthy gut and life
‚Ä¢ In-app chat support from real people

Nerva is a self-help & self-care tool that isn't a replacement for professional medical help. You should make sure to check with a doctor in addition to using the app and before making medical decisions.

Sign up today to finally take back control of your life from Irritable Bowel Syndrome with Nerva!

For more information, please see our Terms and Conditions: http://www.nervaibs.com/terms-and-conditions

comments: Really liked the actual sessions, but when I went to cancel my subscription I found that I couldn't and there isn't any phone number to contact the company. Very much turned off by this kind of subscription "trap", especially after spending so much on the app. Anyone at Nerva support, please CANCEL my subscription.

Seems helpful so far. The price is a bit outrageous for basically 4 or 5 recorded audio sessions that seem to repeat over and over. Almost $100 total for access for only 6 weeks? The app interface could use some work as well. Not what I'd expect, especially given the cost.

It's still too early to see how well it's working at this stage. However, I'm enjoying the sessions and finding that taking a few minutes out of my day to relax is nice. The app doesn't seem to automatically move from day to day though. I need to repeat the exercises on the next day to get it to move on. Not a big deal though as this is fairly easy to fix.

Only just started to use this app but I am enjoying the sessions and find them very relaxing. Bit too early to see results at day three in any consistent way but more than happy to carry on with the program.

The app helps me a lot. I'm only in the middle of my second week and I'm experiencing a massive relief with my IBS symptoms. I trust it will all get even better by the end of the program and the effects will be long lasting. Thanks!!!

title: My IBD Care: Manage Your Crohn‚Äôs & Colitis Better
description:
My IBD Care helps people with Crohn‚Äôs and Colitis live happier, healthier lives.
 
HIGHLIGHTS OF THE FREE APP:

Health record - maintain a record of your health, operations and tests that you can control and share
Trackers and graphs - quick symptom and lifestyle tracking so you can understand and manage your condition more easily
Medication and appointment reminders - keep on top of your care and treatment
Newsfeed - access relevant, condition-specific articles, community news and videos updated all of the time
Library - learn more about living with Crohn‚Äôs or Colitis from articles and videos from the NHS and Crohn‚Äôs & Colitis UK
Message your hospital team - (Added bonus if your hospital is signed up with us)
 
 
SUBSCRIBE TO IMPROVE YOUR LIFESTYLE AND WELLBEING:

Subscription highlights:

Improve aspects of your life with IBD specific guidance covering sleep, wellbeing, exercise and medication habits. 
Find something new as we continue to add new courses.
Courses vary in length with short courses and courses up to 28 days long!
Expert advice* from those who understand living with Crohn‚Äôs and Colitis most.
Daily videos and activities to help you reflect, learn and make changes in your life that work best for you.
Weekly reports to help you track your progress in more detail.
A growing library of Singles - quick advice, videos, tools and practical tips you can use for when you need it most.

*Featuring...
Bu and Gareth, London based Consultant Gastroenterologists
Kay, IBD Specialist nurse with experience of Crohn‚Äôs disease
Jayne, IBD Pharmacist
Sarah, Clinical exercise specialist coach and stoma warrior
And more‚Ä¶.
 
‚úÖ 87% of those with IBD who used our courses for a week said they improved their wellbeing and mental health! üòäüå§

‚úÖ A small study showed that our courses improved control over IBD symptoms after 7 days üßëüèº‚Äç‚öïÔ∏èüë©üèΩ‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è

‚úÖ Try the 7-day free trial to experience all of the above!
 
 
WHAT OTHERS ARE SAYING...
 
‚ÄúIt's empowering to do a course that‚Äôs overall aim is to improve your own symptoms, health and wellbeing‚Äù
‚ÄúCourse is massively supportive - don't usually get this kind of care.‚Äù
‚ÄúFor me, it was like having an additional team away from my team, but for emotional support‚Äù
 
OUR MESSAGE TO YOU

We know that living with Crohn‚Äôs or Colitis can sometimes be difficult, lonely or tiring. It‚Äôs not always easy to get care when you need it or to know what to do to build good health and wellbeing when you‚Äôre in remission.

We‚Äôre a social enterprise, founded by patients and clinicians who think care is better delivered in small, frequent chunks, rather than a few times a year in hospital, or worse, in A&E when a flare gets out of control.

We‚Äôll give you practical tools and advice that can help you to better track, manage and improve your health and wellbeing in the long run.

comments: Simple to use especially if short attention span

This app is terrible as it doesn't work properly and is very glitchy. There's no way of editing my profile and it doesn't seem to flow as an app and finding and inputting data and information. I had to come out of the app and try it another day and it won't let me save my DOB and gender now so it's been uninstalled

App resets every time you switch apps (including during registration) which means that if you need to check any information you lose any progress in the registration/survey/whatever process. A lot of the info this app collects (amount of excercise, amount of sleep, weight, etc) is already collected (often automatically) by other apps (google fit, Fitbit, etc) but there seems no way to link them, so you have to manually copy (with the annoyance that you can't switch apps as mentioned above!)

I did download this app and tried using it. But my hospital isn't one of those linked to it. For me it was just a list of my pills and appointments, which I have in my diary and calendar anyway, and that was about it. It didn't even let me add symptoms apart from a questionnaire that was a one off rather than a daily tracker. Not for me I'm afraid.

Poor - doesn't let you switch between apps as it loses your data. It doesn't include a food diary or detailed symptom log. Many hospitals aren't signed up. The symptoms that are listed are far too medical not everybody speaks the tongue of a doctor! It just seems like an NHS/ third party fishing trip for data, there are far better apps out there to use!

title: Intolerance Food Diary
description:
Intolerance Food Diary is a simple way for you to record, monitor and isolate your food intolerances, food sensitivities, and food allergies.

***This app is no longer in active development. It is offered "as is", and most likely no further updates will be released.***

The heart of the app is a diary in which you can record all the individual food items that you eat for each meal of the day. In addition you can also record any symptoms you experience which may be caused by some of these food items. The exact time and date is recorded for each entry, to build up a comprehensive picture of your diet and symptoms on an hour by hour, day by day basis. Any other information you wish to record can be entered as "Notes" in to the diary.

Entering the information is easy because the Intolerance Food Diary remembers every food item, symptom, or note that you enter into the diary, so the next time you come to type in that same information it appears ready to select in a drop down list. This makes filling in the diary much quicker and more reliable.

Once you have recorded a useful amount of data on your food consumption and symptoms, the app is able to perform a statistical analysis on this information and then give an indication of which food items might be the most likely cause of a specific symptom you are experiencing (the app disregards any notes you have entered). In addition you can look for foods which, after consumption, may have either a short or a long "incubation period" before causing a noticeable symptom. This can be done by adjusting a simple slider to influence how the statistical analysis looks at the data. It should be noted that the information provided in this app does not constitute medical advice. You should always consult with a medical professional before embarking on any course of action which may affect your health.

The app also allows you to create reports from the data in your food and symptom diary. You can select entries between any two dates, and export the data to a PDF report document or a CSV data file (for use in a spreadsheet). The information can then be emailed to either yourself or the medical professional who is monitoring your diet.

Paying a small fee to upgrade to the premium version of the app removes all the banner adverts, and allows you access to the "Backup/Restore Diary" feature. This allows you to backup your entire diary database to a single file, move that file to a new device, and then restore the diary in full to that new device. You can also do the same with your Food Dictionary database which is built up from all the foods you enter into the app. This allows you to carry on using Intolerance Food Diary with a new device.

This app needs certain permissions in order to work correctly. 
-- In App Purchases : This is needed to allow users to upgrade to the premium version of the app. However the free version of the app is still fully functional. The only feature non-premium users will not have access to, is the backup/restore diary function - and this feature is only required if you wish to move your diary to a new device.
-- Photos/Media/Files : Don't worry, the app does not go near any media or files already on your device. The app needs this permission in order to create PDF and CSV reports of your food diary, and to save them on your device in a specific "IntoleranceFoodDiary" folder. The app then needs to be able to read these report files so you can attach them to an email. It also needs file system access for the backup/restore feature which saves the whole diary database to a single file located in the same specific folder.
-- Network Access : The app needs network access to load the banner adverts which are displayed in the non-premium version of the app. No other data is received or transmitted by the app other than that required for the banner adverts.

All data entered into this app is stored locally on your device. It is only accessible by you.

comments: It's very easy to use. Used it for several months now. One thing that could be improved a lot is the analysis of possible intolerances. For example: - It seems the app just tells me what foods I've eaten X hours before the symptom. And obviously the results are just useless. - Add some kind of real correlation analisys between food and symptom occurrences in time that are chosen manually. - At least add a graph between food and symptom occurrences for easy visual comparison.

I really like it's simplicity and you also have the option to receive the summary via email. I had this app back in 2018 when I was eliminating sugar in my body. Deleted it in early 2019 when I became underweight again. But now December 2019, I want to keep track of the food I eat again. So happy to find this for the second time around. This is exactly the app I was looking for. Thank you!

THANK YOU for developing this app. Am finding it a very useful awareness-building and self-training tool. Easy to use. I like it a lot! PS: don't rely on the 'Find intolerences' function though - the algorithm needs a lot of work in order to be useful.

Easy to use. Works well. I'm not sure why we must select "lunch" or "dinner" etc before entering foods eaten. It's all just food .. Eaten at whatever time it was eaten. This not only requires an extra click, it causes problems if you enter two lunches or dinners in the same day. If that problem we're addressed ... And maybe a better looking and more optimized interface, I would give 5 stars. But I do really like it and it's the best I've found on Android.

Been using for a year and I love it, but it could use a "search" feature, for when you want to find the last time you ate ice cream and how it effected you. Right now you have to scroll and find "ice cream" through months of entries. Otherwise it's a great app I use all day every day.

title: Constipation: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. 
Constipation has many causes. Common causes include slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, and pelvic floor disorders. Underlying associated diseases include hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, colon cancer, diverticulitis, and inflammatory bowel disease. Medications associated with constipation include opioids, certain antacids, calcium channel blockers, and anticholinergics. Of those taking opioids about 90% develop constipation. Constipation is more concerning when there is weight loss or anemia, blood is present in the stool, there is a history of inflammatory bowel disease or colon cancer in a person's family, or it is of new onset in someone who is older. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Constipation Guide, Constipation Disease Management & Constipation Disease causes.
Here are features that make this app better than all other Constipation Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications.
